DataElement.preferredName: Edit Over-ride Grade International Classification of Diseases Oncology 1 (ICD-O-1) Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Area for retaining the grade portion (1 digit) of the ICD-O-1 or field trial grade code entered before a conversion to ICD-O-2.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Edit Over-ride Grade International Classification of Diseases Oncology 1
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Area for retaining the grade portion (1 digit) of the ICD-O-1 or field trial grade code entered before a conversion to ICD-O-2.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The type of change made to an element.:To take precedence over and countermand, thereby allowing an activity to continue despite a warning or error.

Concepts.definition: The type of change made to an element.
To take precedence over and countermand, thereby allowing an activity to continue despite a warning or error.

Property.preferredName: Grade International Classification of Diseases Oncology One
Property.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.:A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization (from ICD-10, p1). The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S. (MSH2005_2004_10_12):The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties.:The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

Concepts.definition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

A system of categories to which morbid entries are assigned according to established criteria. Included is the entire range of conditions in a manageable number of categories, grouped to facilitate mortality reporting. It is produced by the World Health Organization. The Clinical Modifications, produced by the United States Dept. of Health and Human Services, are larger extensions used for morbidity and general epidemiological purposes, primarily in the U.S.
The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties.
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: Grade International Classification of Disease for Oncology 1 (ICD-O-1) Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality._The International Classification of Disease for Oncology has been used for nearly 25 years as a tool for coding diagnoses of neoplasms in tumor and cancer registrars and in pathology laboratories. ICD-O is a dual classification with coding systems for both topography and morphology. The topography code describes the site of origin of the neoplasm. The morphology code describes the characteristics of the tumor itself, including its cell type and biologic activity. (from Amazon.com)_The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object._A system of numbered categories for representation of data. [Explanatory Comment: See ICD-O-1 Grade codes for permissible values.]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

ICD-O is a dual classification with coding systems for both topography and morphology. The topography code describes the site of origin of the neoplasm. The morphology code describes the characteristics of the tumor itself, including its cell type and biologic activity. Concepts.longName: International Classification of Diseases for Oncology
Concepts.definition: The International Classification of Diseases for Oncology has been used for nearly 25 years as a tool for coding diagnoses of neoplasms in tumor and cancer registrars and in pathology laboratories. ICD-O is a dual classification with coding systems for both topography and morphology. The topography code describes the site of origin of the neoplasm. The morphology code describes the characteristics of the tumor itself, including its cell type and biologic activity. (from Amazon.com)
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Grade (73-91) ICD-O-1 Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: See grouped data item Morph (73-91) ICD-O-1 [1970] in Appendix E. The item name includes years 1973-91. However, some states may have used the codes for cases before 1973.
